intro: Plectogyne variegata, commonly known as the variegated plectogyne, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and dry forest regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its foliage and fragrance.
